name: Eisbachwelle
desc: A famous river wave where surfers show off their skills in the middle of the city.

name: Monopteros
desc: A Greek-style temple offering the best panoramic view of the English Garden.

name: Kleinhesseloher See
desc: A peaceful lake perfect for renting a pedal boat or enjoying a beer at the Seehaus.

name: Nymphenburger Schlosspark
desc: A vast baroque park with hidden pavilions, canals, and ancient trees.

name: Flaucher
desc: The Isar river's pebble beaches where locals grill, swim, and relax in summer.

name: Residenz MÃ¼nchen
desc: The former royal palace of the Wittelsbach monarchs of Bavaria.

name: Feldherrnhalle
desc: A monumental loggia on Odeonsplatz modeled after the Loggia dei Lanzi in Florence.

name: Alter Peter
desc: The oldest parish church in Munich. The view from the top is worth every step.

name: Siegestor
desc: A three-arched triumphal arch crowned with a statue of Bavaria with four lions.

name: Asamkirche
desc: A stunning Baroque church built by the Asam brothers as their private chapel.

name: Pinakothek der Moderne
desc: One of the world's largest museums for modern and contemporary art.

name: Brandhorst Museum
desc: Famous for its multicolored facade and impressive collection of Andy Warhol pieces.

name: Street Art Museum (MUCA)
desc: Germany's first museum of urban art, hidden in a former power station.

name: Alte Pinakothek
desc: Home to one of the most important collections of Old Master paintings in the world.

name: Lenbachhaus
desc: Famous for its collection of works by the 'Blue Rider' group, including Kandinsky.
